Reviews.Title: “Sparks family trip”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: An absolutely great hotel! Very affordable and clean with an awesome staff! Can not wait to return as I will be staying here again! The room smelled very fresh and clean. When we pulled up I was convinced I had picked a great hotel. We were 1 block off the 76 Strip and had an awesome view of the Sky Surfer, Lumberjack Go-cart track and White Water park. Also very quiet and easy access to other restaraunts and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Always a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: kim h
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to ever do a review but this was such a wonderful place to stay I just could not resist. It's very clean. The staff is so helpful and friendly. This is a family owned hotel and they take pride in what they do. It is a very quiet place yet within walking distance to the "main strip". Easy in and out. They have plenty of places to sit outside and visit with friends and family, large pool, guest laundry, breakfast and the list goes on. You just can not beat the price for what all you get. Will definitely stay again and hope you do too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, economical, and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: TheCoops99
Reviews.Content: The title says it all! Twelve Oaks is clean, affordable, and the staff are friendly and helpful. What more can you ask for? They offer an online coupon for $5.00 off, and also another $1.00 off for paying with cash. The rooms are clean. The location is good, and is especially convenient if you're visiting White Water. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rates and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bmoore22
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a trip to Branson but don't want to throw down a fortune for a room then the Twelve Oaks is your place. 49.99 or 45.99 with online coupon. My husband and I have stayed here three times and we have enjoyed our stay each time. The rooms are clean, the staff are super nice and the location cannot be beat, its just a block off the strip. I would like to see a better complimentary breakfast selection; they usually have muffins, cereal, juice, milk and coffee. But the Plantation Resturant is just 2 blocks away and have a huge breakfast buffet for only 5.99. Dollar for dollar this is where you want to come.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Service!”
Reviews.Author: PrinceAlfred
Reviews.Content: The service at the Twelve Oaks Inn went way beyond our expectations! The people were so friendly and they answered all our questions for us. My niece left her swimsuit in the room, and someone from the hotel found my sister's address on the invoice and MAILED it her w/o even being asked!!! I call that service! The rooms and breakfast are good for the price, and the little pool is actually very clean and refreshing. The water seemed soothing and relaxing; kind of difficult to explain, but nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Becky B
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an inexpensive way to go on vacation this year, and this was a true Godsend. I found the information about it here on TripAdvisor and everything everyone said was true. The people at the front desk, as well as the cleaning staff were extremely nice and helpful. The room was modest, but very clean and nicely taken care of. The breakfast was a nice way to start our day. It was mostly cereal and toast/bagels and donuts with coffee and juice. The pool wasn't very large, but was rarely crowded. It truly became our home away from home, and I would definitely stay there again! It is also conveniently located close to everything, but on the yellow route, so you can avoid 76/Main St really easily. And I paid cash and used the coupon for every night that we could (the cruise in happened that weekend, so there were 2 nights we couldn't use it), plus we stayed 8 nights, so we got one night free! I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a great, economical getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and comfy room!”
Reviews.Author: laura m
Reviews.Content: We did the family suite -- two rooms with two queen beds each and a full kitchen -- mostly b/c another space without the kitchen but with all the beds was already booked. I was a bit nervous b/c it was so inexpensive but found it to be extremely clean and with comfy mattresses. As a bonus it is nearby but off the main drag so it was nice and quiet. We skipped the breakfast but did make use of the pool late one night. The only negative I would have to say is when we asked at the desk for a recommendation for a place to eat, they kept pointing us towards fast food or chains....when I finally declared my intentions of a "sit down and they will serve us restaurant that we can't get everywhere" we were directed to a restaurant that fit the bill....

Reviews.Title: “My mind is blown!”
Reviews.Author: Tifany A
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to branson looking for a hotel that was decently priced as well as semi nice. When we decided to stay at twelve oaks inn my mind was continuously blown by how amazing it was. First of all it only costed us around 40 a night (we used the coupon). Second the ladies at the front desk were so nice and caring and you could tell that these people actually enjoyed their jobs. When i went up to the room it was very clean and spacious. The only negative thing i could say about this place would be that when we first entered the room it was a little hot in there which is understandable since im assuming they were trying to conserve electricity (once we adjusted the A/C it became cool though). There pool was clean and big. Every morning we recieved room service so we never were without a towel and the cleaning staff was also very nice. On a final note, we ate their breakfast every morning and it was probably the best part because they had everything from fresh donuts to all different kinds of toast (even applebutter!!!!!!) and cereal and a juice machine. Check out was also very easy! I will for sure be staying here again next time i travel to branson!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be ranked higher than 26 out of 166!!”
Reviews.Author: Ray N
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! Very clean, friendly, the owners are GREAT!! We come to Branson up to 6 times a year, and this is our second home! It would not feel the same if we stayed anywhere else. This hotel is always full so we are not the only ones that love it, we have been coming to Twelve Oaks for years. Leave the lights on....were on our way! Ray & Martie Kansas

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Jo S
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here and the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. I'm a smoker and got a smoking room and the room smelled really great. Usually smoking rooms in hotels you can really smell the smoke, but not at the Twelve Oaks Inn. They take extra care to make your room smell clean and look clean. The price of the room was excellent also. We will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean N Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Yang S
Reviews.Content: It's clean and cheap. Near White Water Park. For someone whose primary goal is to get wet in White Water Park. This is the perfect place. Breakfast is ok. Room includes Free WiFi, Refrigerator, and dryer.

Reviews.Title: “always a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cjordon
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a 5 star hotel this isn't it, but if you're looking for value that also equals clean, comfortable rooms this hotel is perfect. We have stayed here more times than I can count and we have never had a complaint. The front desk staff is always friendly along with everyone we encounter there. We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Twelve Oaks since it was built. Though I have not gone every year since then, I have been most of them. It has changed owners since I first started staying but quality and service has not suffered. Could you find a place with a bigger pool, gym, etc? Yes. But would you pay such a great rate? No. The service is great, the rates are great, and after all...you are just looking for a clean room with friendly service and a good rate. That's Twelve Oaks! And, it's just off the strip, close to White Water, the Track, and many shows. It's very close to Sherherd of the Hills Expressway and on theYellow Route so access to other attractions is only minutes away! Overall, considering all things, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better place to stay!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: just outside of St. Louis, MO
Reviews.Title: “Great clean, affordable American owned hotel”
Reviews.Author: ErinC76
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here and I know that we will be back! I love that it is a small, independently owned hotel, the atmosphere is relaxed and not too stuffy. My husband and I came to Branson for a few days before heading out to Tablerock lake and this place is perfect for us. Our king size room was clean and cool equipped with a fridge, coffemaker and cable tv. The pool is just the right size and plenty of seating, we liked to grab a table and just chill by the pool in the evening. We actually booked a regular king but got upgraded to a jacuzzi room due to some scheduling conflicts from another guest. I don't normally get a jacuzzi room anywhere because I worry they aren't clean but this one was spotless and like brand new. The hotel serves a very basic continental breakfast but it's got what I usually eat anyway which is coffee and cereal. It's very affordable and although I don't have kids I would think it would be very comfortable for a family too! It's just about a street over from 76 so it's quiet but close to everything. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen D
Reviews.Content: The people treat you wonderfully. It takes you back to the mom and pop days, the price is wonderful and it is a little bit off the strip so there is not a lot of car noise or traffic. The ro.oms are clean and the beds are comfortable, I also love that there is WI-FI

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: eddiefan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Twelve Oaks Inn several times now and have enjoyed each stay. It is clean and quiet and has a friendly staff. They have in room coffee and a refrig which makes the stay even nicer. Be sure to check them out!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for little price”
Reviews.Author: Karen A
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay. It was clean and affordable. The staff were all very nice and helpful. The rooms were all very clean. There were mini fridges in the rooms and you could get a microwave for a minimal price so that was nice. There was also a small park with bbq grills right beside it so we didnt have to spend the extra money to eat out. The beds are firm and there was just a few selections for breakfast, but none of that bothered me. I will stay there again and recomend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: kbake00y
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. Room was clean and well decorated. I cant say anything about their breakfast because we eat out but it looked sufficient. Only recommendation is to take out the body wash dispensers in the shower. Ours was empty and at the wrong location, My wife and I kept hitting it while showering. Also install curved shower curtain rods like alot of hotels have, otherwise a great stay. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: RCW3006
Reviews.Content: Great room. clean and neet. good location block off the main strip. nice pool..

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Oscar M
Reviews.Content: I would have to say the hotel was alright. But I would not stay there again till they put new beds in all there rooms. I went to sleep around 10pm because of a long drive and exhusted and then I was back up at 3AM and could not go back to sleep. Also the need to get staff members in uniforms so you know who is who and the one staff person I seen I had no clue that he work there till I seen the clean cart I would have thought he was a homeless person and they just gave him a job that day. And then for there breakfast it needs to be more then just donunts, ceral and breed.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth of July trip to Branson”
Reviews.Author: willietbillt
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay at Twelve Oaks Inn was our third time to stay there, the location is fantastic , easy access to activities, the only problems we had was parking upon returning from an outing and the room had an odor similar to mold for some time before the ac could clear it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Clean, 4.5 out of 5.0”
Reviews.Author: Dennis G
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed for around $50 plus tax (two queen beds) during the July 4th holiday week. The room was nothing fancy but was clean and well maintained. Will definitely stay there again if returning to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “The Twelve Oaks Inn”
Reviews.Author: kim p
Reviews.Content: we went to this hotel for our fourth of july vacation. the staff was very nice and helpful. the rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable.the room rate is very afforable. they have a large pool that is open at 9 am and dont close till 11 pm. had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Simple but very clean place to stay."”
Reviews.Author: k p
Reviews.Content: I am a 47 year old female. My teenage daughter and I stayed one night here in June '12. The hotel is nothing fancy and the room decorations are dated but it was very clean. I am extremely picky about hotels being clean and it passed my inspection. It is located in a quiet area yet is very close to everything. We felt very safe and got a good nights sleep. The front desk attendents were friendly and helpful. We did not swim in the pool but it looked to be very clean as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families.”
Reviews.Author: jeanniechu
Reviews.Content: We didn't bring kids but it would be perfect for familiesw

Reviews.Title: “Good people, great price, clean modest rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ysoloud
Reviews.Content: I will be back for another stay. It is not a five star hotel, but if you have a family and need a clean and safe place to stay, you look is over.

Reviews.Title: “Twelve Oaks Inn”
Reviews.Author: AKButler
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and it was a great experience. It is an older hotel but it is remodeled so it is absolutely charming. The rates were also excellent. The location was great. They were very helpful at the desk referring me to several ticket outlets to get discount tickets and warning me about traffic on "the strip" during rush hour. The tickets I bought were delivered free to the hotel and ready for me when I checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: SMMCW
Reviews.Content: I stumbled on this goldmine, this past weekend. We frequent Branson a lot, I wanted an inexpensive place to stay with my family and found a great deal!!!! Place was very clean!! pool was a great addition to our stay also. My total for a Saturday night was $44 including tax. I did have a coupon from trip advisor, plus paid with cash so that was another dollar off. Great place at a great price!!! Will definitely be using Twelve Oaks Inn in the future, I plan on making them my second home in Branson!!

Reviews.Title: “Over Night”
Reviews.Author: Cindy D
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at Twelve Oaks on June 20 and were very pleased with the family suite. We were able to meet family working at a a local camp and all stay together. The staff was very friendly. The area was very quiet and we appreciated the fact that the Inn was on the Yellow Route away from the traffic. We will definitely stay at Twelve Oaks in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Misti H
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at Twelve Oaks Inn from 6/13/12 to 6/17/12. It is always a wonderful place to stay. The first time we stayed there was in 1997 and we stay there everytime we go to Branson if we are able to get a room during our stay in Branson. Since it is located just off the 76 strip it is a nice quiet place to stay. It is a very clean and well kept up and the staff could not possibly be any nicer. We enjoyed the pool every night and the convenience of a refrigerator in our room! We are looking forward to staying there again!!!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: kenvonn
Reviews.Content: It's a wonderful place to stay. We stay there every time we are in Branson. It is clean and very affordable and the staff is always friendly and helpful. We highly recommend Twelve Oaks.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywheres else!”
Reviews.Author: 18wheeltraveler
Reviews.Content: We were tired, crabby, & chose this place over the internet,hoping for the best as reviews sometimes aren't what they should be. We also drove a little out of the way to stay here as we really didn't know the area. What a surprize!! The rates ARE reasonable, & holy cow!! This wasn't a room--its like a suite!! It's bigger than most rooms we've had for this price, & very clean. The staff is awesome, & dealt with my crabbiness when we got here quite well. It was well worth the mistake we made of driving those few extra miles to stay in a clean place. We're glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “'Very Pleased"”
Reviews.Author: 295Deidre_P_12
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were very pleased with our stay at twelve oaks inn. I have never stayed in a hotel that was as clean as this inn. The staff was very friendly and the location was perfect. The only complaint is the bed was a little hard, but for the price and the money I saved, I could deal with a hard bed. We will stay there again should we decide to return to Branson in the future. DP Georgetown, La.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple.”
Reviews.Author: mousitch1
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms with fridges!. Clean and nice. Quiet with friendly staff. Will stay again. A no brainer!

Reviews.Title: “Lifetime Relationship with Twelve Oaks Inn”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Twelve Oaks Inn for the past 30 years (before they had phones in the room). It was a nice getaway from the phones back then. My parents began bringing me as a teenager and I've continued the tradition. Rooms are always clean, staff are very friendly, great location just off Hwy 76 (away from the hustle and bustle), easy access off of Hwy 76, located across from the major water park, and near to Silver Dollar City. We just returned this past Saturday from a few days in Branson where we stays at Twelve Oaks Inn. I can always count on everything being just like I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Stak”
Reviews.Author: T J
Reviews.Content: My family and have made Twelve Oaks our Branson home. We've stayed there the last several trips to Branson and always find the motel clean and very convenient to all attractions. The staff is always friendly and ready to help. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room to lay your head at night. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: mitchy74
Reviews.Content: This is a "value" room. It is older, so furnishings are a big outdate, but clean, clean, clean. We are out all day and just look for a clean room to sleep. This certainly fits the bill. It does have a small pool that would be sufficient for a quick dip in the summer. Light continental breakfast, nothing too fancy. The location is great, on the yellow route, very easy to get in a out of. There is a cool zip line thing just by it that is fun to watch at night. Very friendly front desk, easy checkout, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the price”
Reviews.Author: BigEFortSmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel last weekend and I got to say for $39 a night you just can't beat it. The room was probably one of the cleanest room I've ever stayed in at a budget motel. I've stayed in hotels over $100 that weren't this clean and smelled this good. The bed was very comfortable. Pillows kind of small but worked just fine. The continental breakfast was average but then again for $39 you can afford to go out to eat breakfast. It is only a couple miles from Silver Dollar City right behind the new zipline ride. The only thing I didn't like was when they tried to charge me for a 3 year old that was sleeping in the same bed as me but the gentleman at the front desk waived the fee for me anyways. If you are looking for a nice, cheap, close to everything motel in Branson, then this is your place. We bought season passes to Silver Dollar City and we'll for sure stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Barryjnc
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. Kind polite friendly people that took our reservation, greeted us and checked us out. Did not expect it to be this great with the low rate...even had frig in room. We could tell it was home owned and they cared about their business & their guests. Quiet and VERY CLEAN rooms and grounds. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for.”
Reviews.Author: eastinservices
Reviews.Content: I do not like hunting for motels. When I find one I like I use that one exclusively. I needed to do some business in Branson. Just wanted a nice clean quiet room. This was just the ticket. Located a few blocks off the main street so it was very quiet. Rooms are simple and well kept. The rate was low for this kind of room. Very nice young family run the place. They were friendly and were interested in helping me find the places I needed to go in town. He told me they even have a frequent stayer program. I will be making this MY motel in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Far Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Connie R
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect a lot from this hotel given the low rate. Granted, it was off season when we visited, but the rate was well below several of the other hotels. In fact, when we arrived, they said they had a special they just started and gave us an even lower rate! My expectations were far exceeded. Outside room entrances, but our king room with a couch was a large L-shaped room, beautifully decorated and very clean. The family that owns it redecorated the rooms when they took over five years ago. The mattress was soft, but I still slept well. Soap/shampoo combo is in a liquid dispenser in the shower. You may want to bring your own if you prefer bar soap. The sink is outside of the bathroom--my preference so two can get dressed at the same time. Hair dryers are in the rooms, but you have to ask for an iron at the desk. Breakfast was not huge, but enough to start the day: cereal, bagels/donuts, juice and coffee. The owner worked the front desk and was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several places in Branson, as it is one of our favorite destinations. This is our first time staying at Twelve Oaks. We don't look for fancy, we look for clean, comfortable, safe and friendly. Twelve Oaks was all that and more. We also don't like to stay on the main strip, like to avoid the hustle and bustle, Twelve Oaks is just the right distance off the main strip with very easy access to the main strip. The front desk helped us acquire show tickets as soon as we arrived, to a show that started in less than an hour. Very clean, friendly, with helpful staff. We stayed in the family 3 bed unit, great beds, very comfortable, great accomodations. We also had a 2 double bed, handicapped room for my mother. Very roomy accomodations in both units. I think we have found our favorite place to stay in Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Keith B
Reviews.Content: Super clean rooms,great staff,great location.We have stayed here many times and had never had a problem or had bad service. My wife and I don't stay anywhere else.In the off season it's so quiet and very low traffic noise makes for nice sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Brittll
Reviews.Content: We loved it and will consider Twelve Oaks again. We spent 3 nights here mid December and it was great. We thought the bed was one of the most comfortable beds we had ever slept on (lets put it this way, I did not toss and turn). The room was exceptionally clean, especially the bathroom. We found the employees to be very friendly and chatty.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD but could be BETTER”
Reviews.Author: OKBOWTIE
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family apartment for 2 nights over the Vet day Holidays. We were in town to visit the College of the Ozarks with our daughter and the G/P. Room was dated but clean, No odd odors. We discovered the bathroom only had a small roll of toilet paper and no spare rolls early the next morning and front desk closes at 1100pm till 600am so we couldn't get more till next day. Also kitchen area had not paper towels. Breakfast could use selection upgraded, like waffles or something hot. Not just doughnuts and cereal....

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DonC1228
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Inn several times over the past few years. The rooms have always been clean. They aren't fancy but they have all the necessities that you need for a comfortable stay at a very descent price. The rooms have a small refrigerator, hair dryer and they supply you with bottles of shampoo and lotion. We spend so much time out of the hotel that we find this to be a very good place for sleeping and cleaning up for the busy days while vacationing at a very comfortable price. They do include a light breakfast in their lobby of cereal, toast, oatmeal, donuts and coffee. They are conveniently located just one block off of the busy 76 strip and the strip is very easy to access from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: clubfoot57
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Hotwire for this hotel. We had never heard of it but rolled the dice because of the price. Room and common areas were very clean and well maintained. We were upgraded from 2 doubles to a king without even asking.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will return”
Reviews.Author: Klahn
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful eight nights this past week. The staff is very helpful and friendly and the rooms are clean which is very important to us. We love the outdoor pool. We have tried many places in Branson over the past 22 years of coming there and always like to go back to Twelve Oaks. It is very family oriented. Klahns from Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: cryadk
Reviews.Content: My family and I attempted to stay there over the 4th of July holiday, we have stayed there many times before. Unfortunately the owners do not care about taking care of their repeat customers of many years, the previous year I had an issue with my A/C unit in my room not cooling properly it was switched out 3 times, I never received an apology of any type. Giving them the benefit of the doubt we booked 3 rooms this year upon arriving I was told that one of the rooms they were going to give me was the exact same room I had problems with the previous year, I was very upset and again didn't receive any type of apology or even an attempt at giving me another room since I was noticebly upset the owner refused to even rent me a room we were told we needed to stay else where. So beware don't let the "niceness" of the motel fool you, they have terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “What a great bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Njoylyfe15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I come to twelve oaks and have stayed here to visit family. We like to have our own space so we choose to stay here. We have had nothing but great things to say about this place and are planning another trip in July. It is conveniently located next to the strip, my husband and I would walk to the shoppes and just found it easier than driving. We have used the park for a BBQ and have always stayed in one of the suites. We love our trips here and always choose twelve oaks. My son who is 10 loves that he can go to the park and had made friends easliy with the other guest. My son is planning on going to Kanukuk in July and this is where we will spend our week long adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Owned Find”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysAMomFirst
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite that included two full size beds, a king size bed and a pull out sofa all in one huge room. Included Frig and Microwave. ALL for around $90!!!! Clean and lots of room for a huge family. Shower is a little short for those over 5'5" but it works and is clean. Beds are firm but clean. Nice for a quick overnight trip and open for holiday season. Location is perfect and walking distance to several theaters and attractions. No online reservations and old fashion key entry... Hard to find an older hotel that is well kept, clean and safe. A true find!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TanTanMorrison
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel alot and this has to be one of the cleanest places we have ever stayed! The staff was very helpful with all the places in Branson and we had a wonderful time. The room was comfortable and affordable, we don't need a fancy place to stay when in Branson, we are always out and about. We just want a clean, nice place to sleep and shower....this is the place! Try them out!

Reviews.Title: “nice suprise”
Reviews.Author: torontoros
Reviews.Content: this 2 storey motel is very clean the staff are all helpfull the location is super its just before the strip so your not stuck in trafic the price was average for motels in the area they also have a web site for on line booking and take reservations by phone also , all in all no problems here its a jewl in branson....

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ustravel2277
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit run down, but it wasn't bad. My problems started with pillows that were not on the bed, toenail clippings on the floor by the bed, and small bag of tomatoes that were left from the prior guests stay in a dresser drawer. Housekeeping here was bad! If they could not do just the minimal amount, they probably didn't clean at all. Oh, there was an empty soap dispenser installed in the shower.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: just outside of St. Louis, MO
Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Quiet Affordable--would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: ErinC76
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in June 2010-middle of the week. The hotel is just far enough away from the strip that you can enjoy the pool in peace but close enough that a 1 minute drive gets you in the middle of Branson. It is very cheap but very clean. We didn't require alot of high maintenance, just a place to sleep, shower and swim at night. This place fit the bill. My husband smokes so we like staying at a motel where you have a door that leads right out to the parking lot (he won't smoke in a room). There are deadbolts to lock at night so we felt pretty safe. The breakfast was meager--I was hoping for a banana or oatmeal but all they had was donuts, coffee and juice--not a big deal though since we aren't big breakfast eaters and the room was cheap enough we could've afforded eating out if we had wanted to. The wi-fi worked everytime I logged on so that was a plus too! One note: we did bring a fan to cover up any noise that would come from the rooms above us or the parking lot outside. I think there was a family with a bunch of small kids above us because they jumped around ALOT (at all hours)! But, that isn't the hotels fault --just rude guests. The fan helped buffer the noise a little

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and reasonably clean, but customer relations dismal”
Reviews.Author: conservatravler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Twelve Oaks two nights prior to Memorial Day with a $5 per night coupon, but could only use the coupon for one night because Thursday counts as Memorial Day weekend (?) Rooms were clean and location was fine. We usually stay at a hotel that provides some type of breakfast, but donuts, coffee and juice (no milk) was meager for us. The deal-breaker was my spouse witnessing an encounter between a hotel representative and a child guest. Profanity was used loudly because the child was in the pool when it had apparently not been opened to guests for the season, although this detail was not indicated verbally or in writing. If Thursday counts as Memorial Day weekend, why was the pool not ready for use? Certainly there is NEVER an excuse for using the F-word in the presence of customers of any age. We'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Branson !”
Reviews.Author: DeedeaBolivar_Mo_
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here several times the last 15 years,always clean,guiet,no problems.They have coffee,juice,and doughnuts now that they didn't have years ago,so when my husband teased the man at the desk if they had biscuits and gravy,he said "no" but told us about a place that had a breakfast buffet for $3.99.We went there this morning and was very pleased with food and service at DOCKERS just down the road from Motel.We will be staying there again our next time to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “So Beautiful and Clean, made for a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: slnjln
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Twelve Oaks one other time and we were pleased. However this time the Jacuzzi rooms were taken, the extremely nice women on the phone offered us a room in the Spinning Wheel next door. (They own it as well). We accepted and when we opened the door we were blown away! This room was huge, beautiful and clean. Everything was perfectly placed and the decor was spectacular. There is very little to complain about. However I would suggest softer beds. They were hard for our liking and we didn't rest as well as I would have liked. The other thing is the Jacuzzi looks really cool. However it is small for 2 people and the volume of the built in TV cannot be heard above the jets. Over all we were extremely happy and will most definitely make a habit of staying here. Thank you so much for offering a wonderful place to stay at very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good value.”
Reviews.Author: heehawbr549
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but it was a good place to lay my head at night, which is practically all I want in a hotel when I'm visiting Branson anyway. The door of our room had no deadbolt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but security concerns”
Reviews.Author: CECE1946
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, there is no down comforters as stated, but it is the security that worries us. You get a regular key, which is odd that most use key cards. It has the number of the room and what hotel. So if you lose the key while out, your room could get broken into. I spoke to the desk the gal said "do you know how expensive it is to have key cards?" I said do you know the lawsuit if items are stolen from the room I am in. It is a bit off the beaten trail but easy to access quiet and staff is friendly. I would recommend but would make it clear to anyone the key issue. Personally I wont stay again for this reason. It is a clean no frills motel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value”
Reviews.Author: 1966Airstream
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel for the money spent. Nothing extravagant but clean and everything in working condition. The only complaint is that there were no security locks on the door that you lock after you are in the room so that no one can enter even with a key.

Reviews.Title: “Twelve Oaks Inn is the greatest.”
Reviews.Author: tic5850
Reviews.Content: We were there for 8 nights. It is one of the cleanest motels that we have ever stayed in. They have a 5.00 coupon on their website to use for each night thast you are there. Also, if you stay for 6 nights the 7th night is free. Great location and the office people are the greatest. Made reservations for next year before we left for home this year.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: ozdorothy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to get away for a quick trip to Branson. I found the reviews for the Twelve Oaks Inn very positive so decided to call for rates. Found out that a king room was only $49.95 and if you use the coupon on their website, it is only $45.95 a night. I couldn't pass it up. All the reviews were right on. The Twelve Oaks Inn was very, very clean, easily located, and easy to get around. The staff (Alan) couldn't have been more friendly. There are no frills but who needs them - we weren't there to hang out in our room. I would highly recommend the Twelve Oaks Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good service, clean and neat”
Reviews.Author: BobEdmond_OK
Reviews.Content: Located on the yellow route away from major traffic hassles. Staff was friendly and informative. Room was spotless, as described by other reviwers. If you are looking for a great value in a "no frills" motel with clean, comfortable rooms, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, staff was excellent & very nice location!”
Reviews.Author: freachie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, they had a buy two nights & get a third free deal, which was great becasue we were on a tight vacation budget!. It was super clean, no frills (which was fine!), they had what we needed. One thing that really impressed me was that I had brought my own pillow to sleep on..the housekeeper not only placed my pillow on the bed nicely, but also tucked in the end of the pillowcase! It sounds simple, but showed me that they really cared about the guests. It's close to everything, but off the busy roads and was really quiet! We are planning to come back and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Family trip”
Reviews.Author: IAMomwkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August for 3 nights which they had a deal where we paid for 2 nights and got the 3rd night free. Excellent value. When traveling with kids,the only downside to the hotel was the pool. The pool had a 3 ft section and then a 7ft and 9ft section. It wasn't for small kids. The 3ft section was very small compared to the deep end.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: davab
Reviews.Content: My mom, daughter and two nephews spent one night at the Twelve Oaks Inn and it was the perfect location for us. It's close to White Water and conveniently located to the other areas we were interested in. The double queen room was immaculate and very comfortable. The price is very affordable. It's not a fancy hotel but we weren't looking for fancy. It was very nice and had everything we needed. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I love Twelve Oaks Inn”
Reviews.Author: jlbounds1427
Reviews.Content: I love this place! It is quiet, great location and always clean! They are so friendly and helpful. The first time we came, we had our dogs and they do not take pets. They called around and found us another hotel that does take pets. I will always stay here. It's close to 76 but far enough away to be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Clean & Affordable Stay”
Reviews.Author: StickyZap
Reviews.Content: The Twelve Oaks was exceptionally clean and very affordable (book thru the hotel and go to their website to print a $5 off per night coupon - total for 2 nights was $90). The staff was very friendly, pool was a good size - ranged from 3'-9' deep and clean, rooms were quiet, and a modest breakfast of toast/jelly and donuts with juice/coffee/tea was served. Easy location to avoid 76 traffic jams, fast drive to/from Silver Dollar City, also good walking distance from shops/shows etc. Walked to and ate at Elenitas Mexican Cafe - good food, very fast and friendly service. Great guacamole. Had waffle cones at The Dessert Station - excellent "small town" option as compared to Andy's across the street. Great ice cream and very good service with a cozy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: nubbin74960
Reviews.Content: This is a basic motor inn type hotel, but it is well kept and very CLEAN. There are no freebies or breakfast bar, just coffee and donuts. It is off the main strip but easy to find and access (take the yellow route) . They do only provide one pillow apiece so if you like more you might ask or bring your own. They actaully still use keys and not the key cards, (havent seen keys in a long time). It is only $46 a night that's tax included w/ the $5 coupon from their website. So if you dont expect something extravagant this is a nice place to stay while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, easy access.”
Reviews.Author: JRSOhio
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Twelve Oaks for an entire week in room 212 for our thirtieth anniversary. The room was very clean and large with a comfortable sofa. If you're looking for a clean, quiet, no frills hotel, look no further. We loved this place. The location is great too. Even when the strip was traffic jammed, we'd take a side street to the 'yellow route' and drive right to the hotel. Tip: If you're planning to attend shows, don't buy your tickets before you arrive in Branson. Pick up a few coupon books and a list from allaccessbranson.com at the front desk. Compare to determine the best deal. Also, if you're planning to attend multiple shows at the same theater, you can often buy the second show at half price at the theater when you show your ticket stub. Also, some of the less advertised shows, like Doug Gabriel, are great, and some of the highly advertised shows, like Red Skelton, aren't worth attending.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best motels I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: informed_preacher
Reviews.Content: This motel is absolutely fantastic!! The office stays open until 11:00 but they stayed late to wait on us. The staff is available after hours by phone (they live on property). The grounds were immaculate. The rooms fresh, clean, and spacious. The pool well maintained. The staff very friendly and accomodating. They were a wealth of information about the area and even turned us on to a restaurant that the locals only know about. and, not meaning to be "politically incorrect", the motel is completely American owned, operated, and staffed. Located just a block off "the strip" they are in a prime location. For the price, or any price for that matter, this is one of the best motels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “I almost hate to let the "secret" out”
Reviews.Author: ozarksportsgal
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to share this wonderful jewel of a hotel. I don't want to paint myself into a corner and find that I can get no reservations due to the terrific reviews and word of mouth. We have enjoyed each visit. I agree with the many others. It is: CLEAN, quite, affordable and convenient. For those who wonder, the Internet connection has been good. You may want to sit closer to the room's window to get the best signal strength. The parking spaces *seem* wider than normal. That may be my imagination though. We could enter and exit our vehicle without fear of dinging or being dinged. Our only complaint would be the hard mattresses. At least they are not saggy and do not have the multitude of questionable stains that you see at other hotels. Our solution to the hard mattress is to buy a very inexpensive mattress pad and add it to the mattress the next time we stay. I don't know if we will do that, or not...but it has crossed our minds. I need to add: On one visit I needed help carrying my Mom's oxygen tank into the room. In less than five minutes a VERY helpful worker was at my vehicle helping to remove, carry and set up the tank. He even offered to help with the oxygen generator. Excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel In The Ozarks”
Reviews.Author: BowTied
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Twelve Oaks Inn on our way to an Elderhostel in Arkansas. We chose this motel because of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed. We booked directly through the motel and used a $5 off/night coupon from the motel's web site to lower the two night stay to $78.79 including taxes. Our first floor room was so quiet that we didn't hear a severe thunderstorm that raged during our first night. The room was exceedingly clean and odor-free. My wife commented that she examined the bathroom floor (a habit unique to the female of the species) and pronounced it spotless. She said that if the corners of a bathroom floor are clean, that is a very positive indicator for the rest of the room. The room itself was comfortable with a queen bed, table and two armchairs. The wireless internet worked flawlessly. Several ice machines are available, and a refrigerator can be placed in the room for $5/day. The free continental breakfast is basic, but filling. Twelve Oaks Inn is on a quiet side street, only a block from the very busy "strip". Several restaurants are close-by, including a Wendy's, less than a five minute walk. We had no interest in the shows, but a number are quite close-by and a Walgreen's is just a few block east. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Housekeeping added a blanket to the bed and brought us extra pillows. We met another couple who visit Branson often and always stay at Twelve Oaks Inn. After our stay, I certainly can understand why.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mommy2aQT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 12 Oaks in October as a get away from me and my husband. We stayed in the jacuzzi suite and loved it! Room is large, tub was wonderful, very clean, can't beat the price, very quite area. Only little down fall, hard bed... but all in all we really couldn't complain. Will be at the top of our list for our next visit to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “I found a gem”
Reviews.Author: Travelermike99
Reviews.Content: I was referred to the twelve oaks by many of my friends and they were absolutely right. This motel is awesome. The place is spotless, the price was less than anywhere else and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Now I know where to stay when I visit Branson. My friends also recommended the Spinning Wheel Inn next door which is the same owners. I'm sure you'll enjoy your stay as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SH-from-JCMO
Reviews.Content: We booked Twelve Oaks Inn after reading so many favorable reviews on Tripadvisor.com. The other reviews are right -- this is a very clean, very quiet place to stay for a good value. It is in a good location very near attractions, yet with very easy access to the alternate routes if you want to skip the traffic. The pool area was very clean and attractive (although we didn't get to use it because of unseasonably cool weather). We got a great deal on a jacuzzi room with a king-size bed, and really enjoyed our 3-night stay. The continental breakfast is very limited (just doughnuts and microwave oatmeal mix and oj). Also, do not expect any extras that other budget hotels provide --- such as complimentary shampoo or hand lotion, or an in-room coffee maker. (The hotel website doesn't say these things are included; we just assumed). Overall, Twelve Oaks is a nice place to stay for a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “extra large room”
Reviews.Author: grammy2007
Reviews.Content: I just came back from branson and had to write a review for this hotel. It was only a block off the strip, so it was in a great location, but not totally surrounded by concrete. There is a small park next to it, where your children can play and even a grill, horseshoes and volleyball area if you wanted to join the fun. We stayed in room 212 and i recommend that room if your looking for comfort. I was totally surprised when i walked in. The room was larger than a regular room, it was more like a room and a half. It was L shaped and had alot of space. It didn't have a fridge,microwave, coffee pot or iron that you may find in other places, but it didn't matter to us, we don't usually use that anyway. Where the bed was located made it very quiet and comfortable. My husband even watched TV after i went to bed, and it didn't even bother me, because of where the bed was located.I heard no outside noise, which made it great. I spoke to the manager and he told me that not every room is as big as that one, so if your looking for space get it. But there are family rooms, king size w/ jacuzzis, and even an apartment. We used the internet coupon and paid $49.00 for our room and even stayed an extra night because of the price. It was the standard king size room.I highly recommend this place if your just looking for a very clean, and friendly place. I know that will be where i go next time..So enjoy your vacation and spend less money , but get a great place too.

Reviews.Title: “Great PLace”
Reviews.Author: charliesurplus
Reviews.Content: Highly recomend. One of the cleanest motels we've stayed at. Staff was very friendly and helpful and the prices very low.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: TRBinKansas
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased to find the Inn was especially clean and had all the furnishing I needed for an overnight stay. The low price made me wonder how I might find things on my arrival, but I could not have been more pleased, especially with how clean the unit was. I hope my tip expressed my appreciation.... I'll tell my friends about this place and will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Quiet, but close to attractions in Branson”
Reviews.Author: By_His_Grace
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews saying how clean this place is. They were right. We ate at the Plantation near by and the cashier asked where we were staying. When I said the Twelve Oaks Inn, he said "the clean motel, it is the only place I recommend in Branson." It is nicely located a block away from the main drag on 76, far enough to be quiet. The people at the desk were very helpful. There is coupon on their website. I highly recommend this place and will stay here again if we ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: SanditeMom
Reviews.Content: Our regular place we stay was still closed for the season, so at the last minute we had to book 2 rooms for 3 nights. Twelve Oaks was VERY affordable and EXTREMELY clean and I'm very picky when it comes to cleanliness. There was new carpet and tile and I could still smell the fresh paint. The staff was friendly and helpful and it was very quiet. Thanks for a GREAT Spring Break. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonder Place Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. It was wonderful! Very clean, just off the Branson strip. It was great. Don't forget to print off the coupon they have on their website sometime. It was just great.

Reviews.Title: “Twelve Oaks Scores High Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The last five years for Family vacations and roadtrips with my sisters, we always stay at the Twelve Oaks. Nothing fancy but very clean, comfortable with reasonable rates and the management is alway nice. It is off the main strip but with easy access for the highway to Silver Dollar City, just down the street from Celebration City and Roy Rogers Museum. I always refer coworkers and friends there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, very clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All the positive remarks from the previous reviews were right on! This place is very clean and you really can't beat the price. This is the best motel I have ever stayed at and we are very picky about cleanliness. They are friendlly, the room is clean, the whirlpool looks brand new and the carpet and furniture are in great condition. The motel is just a block off the main strip so it is very quiet and pleasant! I highly recommend staying here. You will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little motel”
Reviews.Author: TurtleGirl2010
Reviews.Content: This was just a top-notch little place. We stayed in the "honeymoon suite," which was just a larger room with a jacuzzi tub in it. It was absolutely spotless. Service at the front desk was pleasant, friendly, and prompt. No complaints about this motel. If you don't have the need for a "real" hot tub or a pool (which this motel does not have), and you just want an affordable, impeccably clean place to rest your weary head, then you'll be happy here. We paid $47 for that honeymoon suite, and we felt it was money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless!!!! Picky mother of 4 loves this place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jhuber65
Reviews.Content: Our kids love Branson (and we do too) and so we try to go twice a year. It is so expensive to travel with a group of 6. Often we have paid the big prices and been disappointed with the amenities or been disgusted by the lack of cleanliness. We stayed here last fall and I am getting ready to book another fall outing here. It is basic, but after the amusement parks and shows we really need a CLEAN place just to watch TV, bathe and sleep. I have honestly never stayed in such a clean place. The prices are phenomenal and they are close to everything!!!!! I doubt that I will ever stay anywhere else while in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend trip to Branson and we stayed at The Twelve Oaks Inn. The rooms are very large and clean. Plenty of room for a family of 5 or more. The staff were very nice and friendly, although did not give alot of information about the hotel, such as check out time. although it is posted on the door of the room. It is a basic room with a bed, sofa that makes a bed, a TV and a phone, and nothing else. No hair dryer, no ironing board, no iron, not even a clock. These items can be borrowed from the front desk, but I would suggest bringing your own, as theirs do not work very well. The bathroom is your average hotel size, and very, very clean. If you are looking for a CLEAN place to stay, this is your place, if you want extra's, you should bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Twelve Oaks is Great!”
Reviews.Content: We are just home from a 9 day stay at Twelve Oaks. I chose this hotel strictly on what people said in their reviews on this site. Twelve Oaks is wonderful. Very quiet. Great view of fireworks every night at Celebration City. We stayed in the Family Unit which consists of a king bed and 2 doubles. It also has a couch, dining room table and small refrigerator. Rosie and her staff are extremely helpful and friendly. It was just like staying with family (that you enjoy being with!). We will definately return to Twelve Oaks. It is very clean, quiet and friendly. It is also very reasonably priced. The family unit came out to about $59.00 per night. They give you a free night when you stay for 7!

Reviews.Title: “The playground area is tops”
Reviews.Author: zoomzoom14
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in recent months. The first in April and again in May. My first impression was much like other reviews - clean and comfortable - friendly staff. I returned with two nephews and my two year old daughter in May. My brother's family was not able to get a family suite at such late notice so his family stayed elsewhere. They joined us at Twelve Oaks and after swimming in the pool we were able to spend the afternoon together at the wonderful playground area. This large area is well kept with a horseshoe pit, volleyball/badminton net, basketball, sandbox, swings and picnic table where we played a board game. The staff was friendly and helpful at every request - whether is was checking out sports equipment or assisting in a pizza order. It made our visit with each other complete. Thanks for the extras Twelve Oaks!

Reviews.Title: “Emaculant! And a great price!`”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked for the CAPRICE motel on the strip. This being a first visit from a online rate (meaning we had never been to Branson). The price sound inviting so we thought we'd give it a try. We were very displeased to say the least with the Caprice Motor motel. Well this motel, (Twelve Oaks Inn) was a breath of fresh air! We stayed there in 03/02 and it was great. As clean as can be for a very reasonable priced place to stay. We had to ask for a refund at the other hotel. But not this one. The staff is wonderful. They really seem to care. And the rates are gr8 for the area. It was also much more impressive than another HOTEL we stayed in that is supposed to be a upscale/high class/reputable chain of hotels. I am planning to stay at this hotel again, when opportunity knocks. You should definenatly give this one a try! I don't think you will regret it. From, Missouri

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret Off Of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: fangclub
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our anniversary trip in November '03 and had a fantastic stay! The rooms are H U G E !!! We had a jacuzzi room in the rear building that was only slightly smaller than our apartment at the time. The only problem we had was parking, but several people had trailers in parking spaces. The area was quiet and peaceful, the staff were friendly and very helpful and the location was easier to find than I had thought (behind the Stafford Theater). It was also comforting to see that there is a fire station immediately behind the hotel, you know, just in case! We will DEFINATELY go back to the Twelve Oaks.

Reviews.Title: “Always Clean ~ Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Twelve Oaks Inn on several occasions, and for the money, you can't beat it. It is not new, but very clean, and one of the friendliest plasces that we have stayed there. The staff is wonderful, and will work with you to make your stay a pleasant one. They have a Family Suite, and jacuzzi suites for extremely reasonable prices. PLUS, they are at a very convienent location, just off the strip. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many of the Branson motels, our favorite is Twelve Oaks Inn. This is the cleanest motel you can find with a great staff. The last several trips we haven't even thought of staying any place other than Twelve Oaks. The rooms are pretty basic , not alot of frills, but you won't find any cleaner or a better value than this in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “The cleaniest, most friendly motel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This motel is one of the greatest motels to stay in Branson.....The cleaniest rooms, most friendly personnel, we have ever come across in Branson. Also the most reasonable rates.... The motel is very quiet even since they have opened Green Mountain Drive. The rooms are very spacious and the beds are comfortable. We have stayed at this motel at least twice a year for the last 15 years and we will continue to stay each time we visit Branson.

HotelInfo.Name: Twelve Oaks Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 205 Schaefer Drive, Branson, MO 65616
